column2: DELAWARE DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Delaware
column6: DE

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column6: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column8: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.

column2: 2. When passing another car, you have enough room to return to the driving lane when:
column4: you cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.
column6: you can see both headlights of the car you passed in your rearview mirror.
column8: you are at least 50 feet in front of the vehicle.

column2: 3. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column6: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column8: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.

column2: 4. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column6: you must do it.
column8: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 5. Which statement about blind spots is true?
column4: Large trucks have smaller blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
column6: If traffic conditions permit you should cruise in blind spot of the vehicle ahead.
column8: Before changing lanes, you should check mirrors and look over your shoulder toward the rear.

column2: 6. If you think your tires might have lost contact with the surface of the road, you should:
column4: slow down by shifting to a lower gear.
column6: slowly ease your foot off the gas pedal.
column8: pump the brakes quickly and firmly and slow down.

column2: 7. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column6: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column8: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 8. ABS is the acronym for:
column4: Anti-Locking Brake System
column6: Average-Beam System

column2: 9. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column6: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column8: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Do not pass on the left.
column6: Do not enter

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Turn left or go through
column6: No right turn

column2: 12. When driving in fog, you should never use your high beams because:
column4: vehicles behind you may follow too closely.
column6: the light will reflect back into your eyes.
column8: oncoming vehicles might not see you.

column2: 13. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column4: school crossings.
column6: no passing zones.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway begins
column6: Keep left

column2: 15. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 16. If the vehicle you are driving starts to skid, you should:
column4: stay off the brakes.
column6: turn off the ignition.

column2: 17. When the road is slippery, drivers should _________ their following distance.
column4: decrease
column6: maintain

column2: 18. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column8: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.

column2: 19. Before passing a vehicle or changing lanes, remember to:
column4: sound your horn as you pass.
column6: signal your return to the left lane.
column8: only pass or change lanes if the change can be completedÂ  without speeding.

column2: 20. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: before you enter the intersection.
column6: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 21. This road sign means the road you're driving on:
column4: turns only to the left
column6: turns sharply to the left and then right
column8: turns to the right and then the left

column2: 22. If you are feeling tired while driving, you should:
column4: drink coffee.
column6: stop and get some rest.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: Double curve ahead
column6: Pavement ends

column2: 24. Broken yellow lines:
column4: separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.
column6: separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.
column8: indicate you are in a no passing zone.

column2: 25. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column6: remove yourself before it starts to sink.

column2: 26. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column4: Yield
column6: A No Passing Zone

column2: 27. Alcohol:
column4: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column6: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.

column2: 28. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column4: After the crosswalk.
column6: Before the crosswalk.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
column4: Limited parking
column6: Detour

column2: 30. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To halt the traffic flow.
column6: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column8: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
